fields.description:
*Sprint* isn't translated to Japanese in the JSW cloud issue view.

and also *Story Points*, *Epic Link*

!not_translated_in_CloudJIRA.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sprint isn't translated to Japanese in JSW Cloud issue view.

fields.description:
The *More* button on the Jira issue screen is translated as *Suite*.
Suite could be translated as "what comes next" in English but not to "more".
I would suggest "Plus" or "Autres" for the button.

I notice a lot of non context aware translations in Jira for Dutch and French. 
Google Translate also translates more to suite. I hoped Atlassian would put more effort into this.

Tested on Jira server 8.5.5
fields.summary: More button has a bad translation in French

fields.description:
Greetings,

When multiple users make changes on boards, there's info message shows up: "This board has been updated: Refresh - Ignore".

In Russian version it is displayed as "Панель обновлена: Обновить - Игонорировать". The word "Иг*о*норировать" has extra letter о. Correct translation should be "Игнорировать".
fields.summary: Translation mistake in Russian version - "This board has been updated: Refresh - Ignore"

fields.description:
Issue handled in [https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/VK-445]

 

 

See attached screenshots English, Spanish and Swedish

Suggested Swedish translation: "Processen slutförd"
  -----------------
  
 _NB - my reflection!_

This is not a good wording in the original English file either! It indicates that a process is finished and in action at the same time...

fields.description: The word objektstyper should be changes everywhere to objekttyper.

fields.description:
Create predefined structure and config modal
 # In the Swedish ui, click on "Objektöversikt" and choose "Konfigurera"
 # Click on the tab "Import (-era)"
 # Create an Import configuration and save it
 # You will be presented a Modal called "Skapa Insight-struktur eller importko..."

*This information text should be changed*

*Existing text:* "{color:#de350b}Du kan skapa en mallstruktur i den aktuella objektsöversikten för att komma igång på nolltid. Insight kommer att försöka skapa strukturen beroende på importmodulen.{color}

*Suggested text*: "{color:#00875a}Du kan skapa en mallstruktur i *det aktuella objektschemat* för att komma igång på nolltid. Insight kommer att försöka skapa strukturen beroende på importmodulen."{color}

*This text should also be changed*

*Existing text:* "{color:#de350b}Du kan skapa en mallkonfiguration för att komma igång på nolltid. Insight undersöker objektsöversikten för att se om några objektstyper är lämpliga för den här importmodulen.{color}"

*Suggested text*: "{color:#00875a}Du kan skapa en mallkonfiguration för att komma igång på nolltid. Insight undersöker *objektschemat* för att se om några objekttyper är lämpliga för den här importmodulen."{color}
fields.summary: Erroneous information texts

Import tab, bad naming

fields.description:
The information text is confusing and have some errors.
 # In the Swedish ui, click on "Objektöversikt" and choose Konfigurera
 # Click on the tab "Roller"

h3. *Existing text:* Följande roller har behörighet att hantera och visa denna _objektsöversikt_. _Användare_ kan bara visa _objektsöversikten_, _utvecklare_ kan skapa/redigera objekt och _chefer_ kan också ändra.
h3. *Suggested text*: Följande roller har behörighet att hantera och visa detta objektschema. Object Schema Users kan bara visa objektscheman, Object Schema Developers kan skapa/redigera objekt och Object Schema Managers kan också ändra objektschema.
fields.summary: In the Insight Object Configuration under the tab Roles

Details can be found in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSRVDEV-19687

fields.description: According to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/I18N-3169, the "Admin" in the header means "administration". However, there still are parts that are translated as "administrator" in Japanese. Could you please check and fix them?
fields.summary: Admin for administration is translated as administrator

fields.description:
In the top right corner of Insight the menu for Object Schema is translated to Objektöversikt, see screenshot. This implies an overview for a specific object, not a Schema.

This should be +*Objektschema*+ instead 

!image-2021-03-04-10-35-53-213.png!
fields.summary: Object Schema - Swedish translation

fields.description:
Hi Team, 

We've received the following feedback from a Russian team member:

I noticed the Russian translation in the Confluence Cloud iOS product of the string "Star your frequently viewed spaces to access them quickly." could be improved based on the context where it's used (this is a message for an empty screen). In the current translation the verb Отметить (Russian for Star) is used in infinitive form, whereas it has to be imperative Отметьте in this context.

Link in Smartling: https://dashboard.smartling.com/app/projects/72121ce9e/strings/?sourceKeyword=Star%20your%20frequently%20viewed%20spaces%20to%20access%20them%20quickly&limit=200&offset=0&localeIds=ru-RU

 

If you could take a look at this, that would be great.

 

Many thanks,

Melanie
fields.summary: Incorrect Russian form used in Confluence Cloud iOS translation

fields.description:
You are using "discapacitado" as the translation for disabled.

In spanish, "discapacitado" is the word we use for "handicapped", whilst "inhabilitado" o "deshabilitado" o "desactivado" are good words for disabled.

 

this translation is a bit insensitive and rude 

Used in customer notifications

!image-2021-03-03-16-26-10-205.png!
fields.summary: Disabled is not handicapped

fields.description:
[https://id.atlassian.com/signup?application=bitbucket&continue=https%3A//bitbucket.org/account/signin/%3Foptintocst%3D1%26next%3D/%3Faidsignup%3D1]

When entering password in the field on the page^, the bar shows strength of the password. Currently "Strong" is translated as 力 which is power, and this needs to be fixed to "強い."

Which makes "Good" needs to be updated as currently this is translated as "強い." "普通" would be a good, whose direct translation is "normal" or "okay."
fields.summary: Incorrect Japanese translation for "strong" for password strength

fields.description:
Hello,

We are applying to a public procurement call for tender to supply a tool that will be use to manage projects, tasks and tickets and we are including Jira Software, Jira Service Management and Jira Confluence in our technical offer.

The customer is a public organization from Basque Country in Spain and among their requirements to select a tool is the support of the local language: Esukera.

We believe that we can support all the requisites with Jira except the local language, so this is the reason of us to include Euskera as a supported language in their Cloud products.

Regards,
fields.summary: Include Euskera language in Cloud products

fields.description:
Dear Support Team, 

Would it be possible to get traditional language for confluence 7.11? I can find it for confluence 4.2.13, but can not find it for confluence 7.11

[language| !https://ektron0116.neocities.org/software/traditional.png! ]

Regards, Anderson Hsu
fields.summary: language of tradition

fields.description:
For iOS

In the page header we have "Last updated <date>"  where date is usually something like Feb 22. If the update was even more recent, it shows something like 1 hour ago .
In Italian this translation is a little bit more nuanced.

For days: Ultimo aggiornamento il 22 Febbraio  -- OK
For hours: Ultimo aggiornamento il 15 ore fa  --- `il` should be omitted

"LAST_UPDATED_TIME_AND_USER" = "Ultimo aggiornamento il %1$@ da parte di %2$@";

"LAST_UPDATED_TIME" = "Ultimo aggiornamento il %1$@";
fields.summary: Italian localization for page header should account for recent updates

fields.description:
Hello friends, 

in the Spanish translation of Jira (SW and SM) you are using the term "incidencia" as the translation of issue. 

But in Spanish, "incidencia" is the term we use to refer to an Incident, so everytime a developer "creates an issue with issuetype user story" everything loses the significance.

You shoud use other terms like "asunto", "tema", "caso" or even "ticket"... but not "incidencia" because it has a negative meaning.

 

Thanks!!
Antonio
fields.summary: An "issue" is not an "incident"

fields.description:
Hello, following issue [PSSRV-6246|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/41/PSSRV-6246], I noticed few wrong translations in Jira Software Datacenter 8.4.1
 The permission "Transition issue" is currently translated to "Tickets de transition" but this is meaningless and should be "Transitionner les tickets" or "Transition de tickets".

Another thing, some UI elements are not translated at all like the epic filter in the backlog view !image.png?fromIssue=3927117|width=30,height=115!  "EPICS" should be "ÉPOPPÉES"

Thanks for consideration.

Regards.
fields.summary: French translation mistakes.

fields.description: "Discovery" is translated as "ディスカバリー". If this is a unique term, it should be left in English. Note that in the [app listing page|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214668/insight-discovery?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview], I see both "Discovery" and "discovery".
fields.summary: Translation for "Discovery"

fields.description: "Insight" in the top navigation bar is translated as "インサイト". However this should be English as-is since this is a unique name.
fields.summary: Translation for "Insight"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Team Calendars add existing calendar description missing space in Russian

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to team calendars with Russian as language
 # Select "Add existing calendar"

h3. Expected Results
There is a space between the text and the included link. 

h3. Actual Results
No space between two words. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

"Timeline" string is translated

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The field *_Restrict to this Space Key_* in the macro *_Page Tree_* has an extra letter in Russian version
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page or go to existing page
 # Add a Page tree macro
 # Edit the Page tree macro
 # Field *'_Restrict to this Space Key_'* in the above macro has an extra letter in Russian version.

h3. Expected Results

Extra letter should not be present. It should be _*Ограничить ключом пространства*_
h3. Actual Results

Currently there is extra letter present and it appears as follows:
_*Огранчичить ключом пространства.*_
h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Field Restrict to this Space Key in Page Tree macro has an extra letter in Russian version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page Tree is truncated under browse section while moving a page with French Language.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Test space
 * Create multiple pages upto 10-12
 * Switch profile to French language
 * Open one of the page
 * Click on Move
 * Click on browse section
 * Last page name is not visible or rather appears slashed.

h3. Expected Results

Last page should appear normally as it appears with English language.
h3. Actual Results

Last page name is not visible or rather appears slashed.
fields.summary: Page Tree is truncated under browse section while moving a page with French Language

fields.description:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-75924

 
h3. Issue Summary

In automation for Jira Related issue condition, two different options are translated to the same Dutch text.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language to Dutch.
 # Open Automation Rule.
 # Select Related issue condition
 # Select Related Issue as EPIC.
 # two different options are translated to the same Dutch text.

h3. Expected Results

User sees
 * Matched specific JQL 
 * Does not match specific JQL.

!Screenshot 2021-01-29 at 7.46.31 PM.png|width=299,height=158!
h3. Actual Results

The user sees two different options are translated to the same Dutch text.

!Screenshot 2021-01-29 at 7.55.48 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Dutch Translation Bug in the Automation for Jira condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While German is set as profile/site language, in the search function, the label of the "_type" filter_ in German should be shown as *Typ* with capital T instead of *typ*. The case needs to be like other filter labels.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set German for the language of the Confluence site or profile.
 # Click search on the top right.
 # When the search menu opens, on the left side of the search menu, you can see filter combo boxes. The label for the _type filter_ has the case issue.

!case_problem.png|width=471,height=239!
h3. Expected Results

The label for the type is *Typ* while the German language is set.
h3. Actual Results

The label for the type is *typ* while the German language is set.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Case error in Confluence search filter label in German translation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Translation error in the Dutch notification for an @-mention (Batched Notification mails)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable ⚙️→  System → Batched Email Notifications
 # Set the default language to Dutch
 # Trigger a @-mention email
 # Currently, the message says 'Je bent genoemd in deze issue.'
 !image-2021-01-25-13-33-46-739.png|width=457,height=44!

h3. Expected Results

The message in the @-mention email should be 'Je bent genoemd in dit issue.'
h3. Actual Results

The message in the @-mention email is 'Je bent genoemd in deze issue.'
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Translation error in the Dutch notification for an @-mention

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The time format shown in the original estimate field is incorrect in German and for example, adding hours (S) or weeks (W) shows an error message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to id.atlassian.com and set the language to *German* in Account preferences.
# Open an issue and try to add time in the *Original estimate* field. The sample format shown is *2W 4T 6S 45M*
# Try to add 5 hours as 5S and it gives an error message showing a different sample format *2w 4d 6h 45m*

h3. Expected Results
The sample format should be corrected

h3. Actual Results
Example time format shown misleads the users entering the time estimate

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to enter the time in the format *2w 4d 6h 45m*
fields.summary: Sample time format shown in Original estimate field translation is incorrect in German

fields.description:
||Source||Current Target||Suggested Target||Reason
|Applies to|次に適用します。|適用先|Current target is a sentence|
|Enabled?|有効化しましたか？|有効化|Current target is asking "Did you enable it?"|
 !スクリーンショット 2021-01-22 17.14.03.png|thumbnail! 
 !スクリーンショット 2021-01-22 17.27.06.png|thumbnail! 

Steps to reproduce:
# Prepare a Jira/Confluence Cloud Premium instance
# Access admin.atlassian.com
# Navigate to Security > IP allowlisting

Note that there is an ongoing bug where the translation is not loaded upon initial access(I18N-3300)
fields.summary: Confusing translation for Japanese(IP allowlisting)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The language preference set in id.atlassian.com is not loaded in admin.atlassian.com

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences and set the language as something other than English
 # Wait for several minutes and access admin.atlassian.com

h3. Expected Results
admin.atlassian.com is loaded in the language set in 1

h3. Actual Results
admin.atlassian.com is loaded in English. Confirmed setting Japanese and French, please check the [screen recording|^画面収録 2021-01-22 17.22.08.mov] for details.

h3. Workaround
Performing certain actions loads the preferred language. For example:
# Navigate to Security > IP allowlisting
# Add a new allowlist
# The translation for the preferred language is loaded. However, if you reload the page, it will revert to English

Changing the track in the Release Track menu also has the same behavior too.
fields.summary: The language preference set in id.atlassian.com is not loaded in admin.atlassian.com

fields.description:
Hello,

 

"Move forward from anywhere" is translated as "Avancez, quel que soit l'appareil. " which as a french native speaker sounds a bit weird. Both "avancez" for "move forward" and "quelque soit l'appareil" for "from anywhere"

and again "appareil" for "device" at the end

appareil sounds too vague/global for what we are trying to describe (laptop/mobile/tablet)

Also! the english string is about to be updated to "Move work forward from anywhere..." which may help
Thanks!!
fields.summary: Various french translations in software-onboarding-quickstart.checklist.checklist-view.get-mobile-app-task

fields.description: As is: login.logged.in.description=Klik her for at g\u00e5 til dashboradet. For at logge ind som en anden bruger skal du f\u00f8rst logge ud. Should be: login.logged.in.description=Klik her for at g\u00e5 til dashboardet. For at logge ind som en anden bruger skal du f\u00f8rst logge ud.   The change is "dashboradet"  to "dashboardet"

fields.description:
# "Time" (for Team) is not a Portuguese word... perhaps Brazilian. In Portugal, we use the word "Equipa".
 #  In order to restore a Card back to the Board, you used the expression "Enviar ao Quadro". It sounds strange and is only understandable to those that know Trello quite well already. The right expression could be "Repor no Quadro" that literally means "put back on the Board".

Located here: /manage-profile/profile-and-visibility

Original ticket: https://customerfeedback.atlassian.net/browse/PTDF-5146
fields.summary: Corrections to pt-PT People and Teams translations needed

fields.description:
Hi team,

Here in excentia we are using Jira for 12 years and partners during the last 10 years.

On ALL our clients we change the translation for "issue" to "asunto" instead of "incidencia". I am creating this issue because we can't do that on Jira Cloud.

Currently, "issue" is translated to "incidencia", and:
 * "Incidencia" is related with an incident, something wrong that have to be resolved (on ITIL context also)
 * "Asunto" is (for us) the best translation for the generic word "issue". It means a generic thing that can represent any of the issue types.

On Jira cloud right now we can see that on a project we've got "Incidencias" (incidents),  "Tareas" (tasks) and "Peticiones de Servicio" (service requests) and you can find for "Incidencias" (quite strange)

If you need something, please contact me.

Happy New Year :)

Thanks so much,

--Hugo
fields.summary: Incorrect spanish translation for "issue" (incidencia)

fields.description:
From personal settings, when the language is changed to other languages like French, Dutch, Polski etc, the top and the side nav bar menu is displayed in the respective languages. However, when the language is changed to Norsk, the top and side nav bar remains in English and does not get translated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

From the user's personal settings, change the language to Norsk
h3. Expected Results

The entire page translates to Norwegian. 
h3. Actual Results

The Top and the Side nav bar menu items do not get translated to Norwegian, they continue to be displayed in English.
fields.summary: In Jira, the Top and Side nav bars are not translated when the language is changed to Norwegian

fields.description:
"Atlassian Start" is translated as "start(verb) Atlassian" which makes no sense.

This is a link to start.atlassian.com so I assume treating is a a unique name and keeping it English as-is would be the best? Maybe we want to check the translation for other languages as well.
fields.summary: Wrong translation in the product switcher

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Certain macros (expand and smart links/blocks) on renderer/editor are not fully localized.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create/open/edit any Confluence page
 # Add a expand or smart link/block macro

h3. Expected Results

Placeholder text for title of the expand block should be localized.

Jira issue status/last updated time should be localized in the smart block.

Confluence page status/details ("this page is within the ... space") should be localized.
h3. Actual Results

All above content are in English or partially localized.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Certain macros (expand and smart links/blocks) on renderer/editor are not fully localized

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Since most of the agents do not speak English, I configured the Default Project Language "Romanian". The problem is that some of the menu items are still in English. The entire side panel is in English, too; and that is my major issue, because the agents won't be able to click on the right menu item. I have tested also with the Browser (FF,Chrome) language Romania, but I noticed no difference.
Please see the attached files.
The same issue is detected when onboarding new Customers, the page is in English, even if the Browser Language is in Romanian.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 the side panel menu items (from Projects and Filters page) are not translated at all, which makes it very difficult for non-English agent speaker to select an item, like: Customers or Queues etc.
Please see the images below:


h3. Expected Results
To translate all fields to Romanian

h3. Actual Results
It is still showing in English

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Default Project Language "Romanian" but some of the menu items are still in English.

fields.description:
Replace *понадобит{color:#FF0000}Ь{color}ся* to *понадобится* in description of standard field *Original Estimate*

 

*!image-2020-12-21-16-05-42-520.png|width=753,height=215!*
fields.summary: syntax error

fields.description:
Hi,

the macro "Favorite pages" has a typo in the French version, when no favorites exist. It reads

"Votre list de favoris ne contient aucune page...", where it should be

"Votre list*e* de favoris ne contient aucune page...".
fields.summary: Favorite pages macro has a typo in French

fields.description:
Please correct the typo in Original Estimate field description.
It should be "понадобится" but not "понадобит*ь*ся"

Jira Server 8.13.1

!image-2020-12-09-10-32-09-206.png!
fields.summary: Russian mispelling in Original Estimate field

fields.description: It should be Créer une Epic or Créer un Epic depending on the gender we selected elsewhere for epic. Omitting the pronoun here is bad grammar :)
fields.summary: Grammar incorrect in roadmaps - create epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

German translation is incorrect on Notifications (Next-gen Software and Service projects).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the profile language to German (Deutsch).
 # On a next-gen project, go to Project settings > Notifications.

h3. Expected Results

It will show the information: 

"Notifications for this project will be sent *FROM* the following address" that would be in German "Benachrichtigungen zu diesem Projekt werden von folgender E-Mail-Adresse gesendet:"
h3. Actual Results

It shows:

 "Benachrichtigungen zu diesem Projekt werden an die folgende E-Mail-Adresse gesendet" that in English means "Notifications about this project will be sent *TO* the following email address:"
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: German translation is incorrect on Notifications (Next-gen Software and Service projects)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4170].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
It is not possible to create an IT Service Desk project if the default language is set to Russian

h3. Affected version 
1000.196.0 (Cloud)
1000.824.3 (Cloud)
1000.1446.0 (Cloud)
Service Desk 3.1.9 (Server)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the default language to Russian
# Create an IT Service Desk project

h3. Expected Results
IT Service Desk project created
h3. Actual Results
IT Service Desk project not created
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-17 at 5.52.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 
The following error is thrown:
{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: org.codehaus.jackson.JsonParseException: Unexpected character ('П' (code 1055 / 0x41f)): was expecting comma to separate OBJECT entries
 at [Source: java.io.StringReader@1b32752; line: 11, column: 373]
...
Caused by: org.codehaus.jackson.JsonParseException: Unexpected character ('П' (code 1055 / 0x41f)): was expecting comma to separate OBJECT entries
 at [Source: java.io.StringReader@1b32752; line: 11, column: 373]
...
       	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.sample.SampleDataImporterImpl.parseSampleData(SampleDataImporterImpl.java:64)
{code}

h3.Workaround
Change the default language to English (US), create the IT Service Desk project then change the default language back to Russian
fields.summary: Unable to create IT Service Desk project in default Russian Language

fields.description:
Hi.

In what time will the Ukrainian localization be available?

fields.summary: Ukrainian Language Request

fields.description:
In a Jira Service Desk/Management project's settings under "Customer permissions", the help message has been incorrectly translated.

The English message goes "Agents and project admins can add new customers to a project at any time ...", but the Swedish translation ("Agenter och projektadministratörer kan lägga till ett projekt när som helst ...") means "Agents and project admins can add a project at any time ..."
fields.summary: Incorrect Swedish translation for Customer permissions help message

fields.description:
Small mistake on your marketing email page, it's Français not Française 


https://twitter.com/DominoPivot/status/1332065572343967745
fields.summary: Minor typo in French marketing email

fields.description:
Please check the screenshots attached. The text under the project name has <strong> tags.

I tried English, Spanish, Dutch, and simplified Chinese, but couldn't reproduce the issue. Judging from this, maybe an unnecessary strong tag is inserted in the string level only for Japanese.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-26 16.04.39.png|thumbnail! 
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-26 16.19.19.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unnecessary "<strong>" shown for Japanese

fields.description:
Hey there,

is it possible to change the text "Kontaktieren Sie uns zu" in the Service Desk portal? I have not found the settings to do this by now and it seems to be hardcoded.

It's just about the kind of language we have with our employees, in Germany the "Sie"-form is more unpersonal, so we would like to replace it with "Kontaktiere uns zu" and "Wobei können wir dir helfen?"

 

Kind regards,

Lukas

 

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/119313i941627C15C8044AD/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

 

!image-2020-11-24-11-48-29-179.png!
fields.summary: Option to customize predetermined text in Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Out-of-box filter: "*Reported by me*" is translated to French as "*{color:#de350b}Que j'ai signalées{color}*". However the correct translation would be "*{color:#00875a}Que j'ai signalés{color}*"
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira UI --> Profile --> Change the language to 'français (France)'
 # Navigate to 'Search'
 # On left you will see the translated name for existing filters.

h3. Expected Results

*Reported by me* should be translated to _Que j'ai signalés_
h3. Actual Results

*Reported by me* is translated to _Que j'ai signalées_

h3. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/install-a-custom-language-pack-for-jira-server-295305642.html
fields.summary: Language Pack | French | Filter name | wrong translation

fields.description: Please provide SD portal Latvian language support.
fields.summary: Latvian language support for SD Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when customer browser set to French language, Customer Portal login page translated to French language. However, for "Sign-up" text is using "Connectez-vous". It is better to use  "Inscrivez-vous" because "Connectez-vous" means Login, not Sign-up. 

Refer the screenshot below for current translation:-

h3. Suggested Solution
Use "Inscrivez-vous" instead of "Connectez-vous"

h3. Why this is important
It's better translation.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Use "Inscrivez-vous" instead of "Connectez-vous" for Sign-up text in Customer Portal login page in French language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the customer view, the *Notification on* is displayed as "通知を受け取る" which translates to "Receive notification" and *Notification off* is displayed as "通知をオフにする" which translates to "Turn off notifications"
h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the translation to show *Notification off* as "通知をオンにする" which translates to "Turn on notifications" since the notification is already off.
fields.summary: Improve Japanese translation of "Notification on" and "Notification off" in customer view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the portal invitation email is like this:
# English: Finish signing up to <project>
#* Dutch: Beindig de inschrijving om <project>
# English: Follow the link below to finish signing up to <project>
#* Dutch: Volg onderstaande link om de inschrijving af te ronden <project>

h3. Suggested Solution
# English: Finish signing up to <project>
#* Dutch: Bevestig de inschrijving voor de <project>
# English: Follow the link below to finish signing up to <project>
#* Dutch: Volg de onderstaande link om het aanmelden bij de <project> te voltooien
fields.summary: Improve Dutch translation for portal invitation email

fields.description:
Currently, the portal invitation email is like this:
 * English: +Visit the portal+ to raise requests and get help.
 * Japanese: +ポータルにアクセス+ リクエストを出して助けを得るために。

(Underlined texts are texts with hyperlinks)
 The Japanese translation is broken. It's not forming the shape of a sentence and this is very strange for Japanese customers.

My suggestion is to update to the following:
 * Japanese: +ポータルにアクセス+し、リクエストを作成してサポートを受けてください。
fields.summary: Improve Japanese translation for portal invitation email

fields.description:
The current Finnish translation "Hae ilmoitukset", while an accurate literal translation, actually means "Fetch notifications" which is confusing since nothing is fetched when the user clicks the link.

 

A better translation would be "Tilaa ilmoitukset"
fields.summary: Better translation for "Get notifications" in Finnish

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the Swedish translation for "Get notifications" is "Retrieve message", which confuses the users.
h3. Suggested Solution
The correct translation should be "Få aviseringar"
fields.summary: Improve the Swedish translations for Service Desk
Replace "顧客" with "カスタマー" as Japanese translation for "customer"

fields.description:
Problem Statement

The is currently no available Slovenian language option for Jira Service Desk. This is needed to serve customers who prefer Slovenian language to ease their experience.

Proposed solution

Install Slovenian language pack (option to change lanugage to Slovenian).
fields.summary: Add Slovenian language pack to Jira Service Desk

fields.description: As a customer of JSD, I would like to be able to have my users located in Macedonia to be able to work in JSD using their native language.

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a very large team in Thailand and I don't want to go back using the old email to ticket method. I like the portal for customers instead just like this one I have created ([https://icarasia.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1).]

 

I would like to deploy the portal to my Thai team but unfortunetly English is not their strong suite. Kindly try to help with the Thai Language Pack for Jira Service Desk (CLOUD)

fields.description:
In Korean:
 * *Sat* and *Sun* are using the same word. 토 is Saturday, Sunday is supposed to be 일.
 * The id for the incorrect translation is *roadmap.timeline-table.components.chart.header-cells.sunday*
 * [https://customerfeedback.atlassian.net/browse/JSF-690]**

 

In Russian:
 * *Tue* and *Thur* are using the same word.
The id for the incorrect translation is  *roadmap.timeline-table.components.chart.header-cells.thursday*
 * *Sat* and *Sun* are using the same word
The id for the incorrect translation is  *roadmap.timeline-table.components.chart.header-cells.sunday*
 * [https://jira-feedback.atlassian.net/browse/FEEDBACK-22262]

 

I double checked, and the description for the translators are accurate.
fields.summary: On the Roadmap, the names of days of the week are incorrect in Korean and Russian

fields.description:
Currently, "Work Management" is literally translated as "作業管理". While this is not a mistranslation, it lacks the essence of the capitalization(when capitalized, "Work Management" is a name of a special concept).
 !image (2).png|thumbnail! 

To keep it look like a concept in Japanese as well, how about changing it to " ワークマネジメント"? We see this word used in other Japanese websites as well.
fields.summary: Japanese translation for "Work Management"
Feature to support the installation of language packs from Atlassian Translations

fields.description:
The Icelandic translation is incomplete and you cannot claim your system supports it. Please remove Icelandic from your list of supported languages or allow us to update it for you.

As someone who is from Iceland, i can barely understand some parts of the system. Can i please make corrections to the translations?
fields.summary: Icelandic translation incomplete

fields.description:
The terms "Epic" and "Issues" are inconsistent in French.

Click "Backlog" from left menu -> Click "EPICS" tab under "VERSIONS" tab":

1- "Epic" is either not translated (remain as EPIC) or translated as "Épopée". Please translate all "Epic", "Epic Link" to "Épopée" and "Lien d'épopée" for consistency.

2- "Issue" is translated as "Ticket" and "Demande" across Jira. Please modify "Demande" to "Ticket" for consistency.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Inconsistent translation of "Epic" and "Issue" in French

fields.description:
Click "Issues" at to menu bar -> click "Manage filters"

Two French errors are found:

1- On the left menu, we should read

Préféré{color:#FF0000}(s){color} instead of

Préféré(e)

2- On the middle menu screen, under "Owner" search box ,we should read

Commen{color:#FF0000}cez{color} à taper pour obtenir une liste de correspondances possibles. instead of

Commencer à taper pour obtenir une liste de correspondances possibles.
fields.summary: At "Manage filters" screen, errors in French

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I attached several screenshots with untranslated web items n Confluence Cloud. Language is set to German, some items are still in english.

Additionally I noticed the mix of the terms "add-on" and "app".

Comments and target suggestions are included in screenshots.

Best regards,

Chris
fields.summary: untranslated items in Confluence Cloud (german)

fields.description:
The current translation "通知をオフにする" sounds like "Turn off the notification".

 !Screen Shot 2020-11-06 at 15.32.53.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-11-06 at 15.32.47.png|thumbnail! 

Instead, use "通知を受け取らない" to get aligned with "Notifications on".

Or, we can go with explicit translations for clarity:
 * 通知はオンになっています
 * 通知はオフになっています
fields.summary: Misleading translation for "Notifications off"

fields.description:
1- The X-axis of Burndown Chart is "Time" in English, but translated as "Heure" (Hour) in French.

2- The column name of the last column is "Remaining" which refers to Remaining Story points, but it is translated as "Temps restant" (Remaining Time) in French.
fields.summary: Translation errors in French for Burndown Chart
